title: Missing daughter of Worcester mother in ICE detention found, police say
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: The 13-year-old daughter of a detained Worcester mother was found safe in Massachusetts and is with DCF.
The 17-year-old sister remains missing, with reports suggesting she might be in Brazil with an older sister.
Inside: the board’s role — and what happens next.

title: Here’s what to know about the HHS demand that Mass. erase ‘gender ideology’ from sex ed materials
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: The Trump administration demands Massachusetts remove LGBTQ+ inclusive language from federally funded sex education to avoid losing $2.36 million.
Massachusetts has 60 days to comply with the HHS order to revise Personal Responsibility Education Program materials or face funding cuts.
Production timeline and who’s attached are inside.

title: Filipa Patão shared her thoughts on becoming the inaugural head coach of Boston Legacy FC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Filipa Patão was appointed as the inaugural head coach of Boston Legacy FC after leaving Portuguese club Benfica.
Patão aims to build a strong team identity, emphasizing adaptability for the competitive NWSL league atmosphere.
How the move changes the lineup is explained.

title: Jeremy Swayman feels like a ‘completely different human being’ a year removed from contract dispute
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman enters 2025-26 season without contract issues, focusing on improved performance after a challenging 2024-25 season.
Swayman revamped offseason training and excelled with Team USA, aiming to reclaim form as Bruins' top goalie.
How the move changes the lineup is explained.

title: What Josh McDaniels said about facing the Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Josh McDaniels, Patriots offensive coordinator, faces his former team, the Raiders, in Sunday's home opener two years after being fired.
McDaniels expresses no ill will towards the Raiders, praises new coach Pete Carroll, and emphasizes learning from past experiences.
How the move changes the lineup is explained.

title: Elizabeth Banks cast as Karen Read: What readers said about the limited series role
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Elizabeth Banks will star as Karen Read and executive produce a Prime Video series on Read's murder case, amid mixed reader opinions.
The series explores true crime obsession and is separate from another adaptation; Karen Read was acquitted in June 2025.
Read the quote shaping reactions.

title: 2 New England casinos just ranked the best in the U.S. (that aren’t in Las Vegas)
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Mohegan Sun and Foxwoods in Connecticut rank No. 2 and No. 3 respectively in USA Today's best non-Vegas casinos list.
USA Today's list emphasizes expansive gaming options and guest experiences at over 1,000 U.S. casinos outside Las Vegas.
How the move changes the lineup is explained.

title: What to know about Seisiún, the two-day Irish music festival coming to Boston
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Seisiún is a two-day Irish music festival at Suffolk Downs featuring headliners Dropkick Murphys and The Pogues, the latter's first U.S. show in over 20 years.
The festival includes acts like The Hold Steady and Glen Hansard, with tickets available from $75 and starting times varying between days.
Read what Irish said.

title: CommonWealth Kitchen staff, members speak out over toxic nonprofit: Globe report
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: CommonWealth Kitchen staff and members accuse leadership of creating a toxic workplace and failing to support minority-owned businesses.
Executive Director Jen Faigel faces allegations of fostering a toxic culture; board expresses support while pledging to address concerns.
How the move changes the lineup is explained.

title: 44 proposed Mass. ballot questions, including rent control, move to next step — and 3 don’t make the cut
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: 44 proposed Massachusetts ballot questions, including 40 proposed laws and four constitutional amendments, advance to the next stage.
Groups must collect 74,574 signatures by Dec. 3 for initiatives; constitutional amendments need legislative approval for ballot placement.
Inside: the board’s role — and what happens next.
